data.title: November Sarasota Events Calendar
data.meta_description: November Sarasota Events and Happenings around Sarasota and the suncoast.
data.text:
2024 November Sarasota

Events Calendar

The November Sarasota Events Calendar - the best fun free (or next to nothing) things to do in Sarasota, Florida and around the sun coast.

*Every effort is made to provide accurate information, however, dates, times, places and event schedules are subject to change without notice due to weather conditions, last minute changes or cancellations made by event organizers, mistakes, misinformation from sources and/or events beyond anyone's control, etc. Before making any major plans check with event organizers to confirm date of event and that event has not been canceled at the last minute.) The Calendar is updated as information is made available.

November Sarasota Events

November 1, 2024: Check out the eats at the North Jetty food truck rally. Entertainment, food trucks and games. The North Jetty Park Food Truck Rally series connects people in a fun, social setting and allows for families to get together at the week’s end to relax, eat good food and enjoy a beautiful beach park. 5 p.m. - 9 p.m. North Jetty Park, 1000 S. Casey Key Road, Nokomis, FL.

November 1, 2024: Lakewood Ranch presents the return of Music on Main the first Friday of each month. Live music, beer, wine and food available. Highlight on Local Sports – Trevor Bystrom Band will fill the air with a range of world music and the event will benefit Manatee PAL. Bring your chairs, but leave coolers at home. Dogs are welcome, but must be kept on a short leash. The Main Street is lined with food vendors, beer trucks, and sponsor booths, as well as rides and activities for the kids. Overflow parking is available at the Lakewood Ranch Medical Center. Free. 6 p.m. - 9 p.m. Main Street, Lakewood Ranch, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.

November 1, 2024: It's the Free Music Friday Night Concert. Enjoy the music of Patchouli & Terra Guitarra in Concert in downtown's Centennial Park. Free and open to the public. 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. Bring your chairs and blankets. No alcohol is permitted in Centennial Park. Centennial Park, downtown Venice, FL.

November 1, 2024: The First Friday event runs along the 1400, 1500, 1600 blocks of Main Street, Palm Ave., 1st & 2nd Street. Prepare to be mesmerized by the array of upscale art, home decor and fashion boutiques, each offering their own unique style and collections.. Free admission. 8 p.m. - 11 p.m. Lemon Avenue and State Street, downtown Sarasota, FL.

Sarasota November Events

November 2, 2024: Check out a unique event that brings a touch of Parisian charm to the Gulf Coast. The Le Marche Bohemien open-air marketplace at Five Points Park is a celebration of art, culture, and community, and offers visitors the chance to browse handmade and eclectic creations from a range of talented vendors. Inspired by the iconic Parisian markets that are a fixture of the French capital’s cultural landscape, the marketplace is a vintage collector’s paradise, with wearable clothing and accessories that feature vintage photographs and re-purposing vintage apparel. Other artists will showcase re-purpose furniture and home accessories using chalk paint and stencils in intricate designs. From wall hangings crafted from stained glass and natural elements to sculpted work and intricate jewelry created from antique buttons, sterling silver and semi-precious stones, and more. With its colorful stalls and lively music, Le Marche Bohemien captures the essence of the bohemian spirit that has long been associated with Paris. Free. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Five Points Park, 1 Central Ave, Sarasota, FL

November 2, 2024: It's the 23rd Annual Ferrari's at St. Armand's Circle. Over 75 Ferrari owners will be showing off their rides and competing for the top prize trophy, "Best of Show." Free admission. The show revs up from 9 a.m. - 3 p.m. in circle park. St. Armand's Circle is just over the Ringling Bridge from downtown Sarasota, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 2, 2024: The 22nd Annual Original Mullet Smoke-Off will feature tasty smoked mullet. Florida culture meets art, crafts, music, local cuisine and lots of fun at the annual Terra Ceia Island mullet smoke off and arts an crafts show, held on the grounds of Seabreeze park along the banks of Terra Ceia Bay. Fun for the whole family. Free admission. 10 a.m. - 4 p.m. Seabreeze Park, 55 Horseshoe Loop, Terra Ceia Island, North Manatee County, FL.

November 2, 2024: Enjoy great food, wine and entertainment at the 21st Annual Suncoast Food & Wine Fest. Enjoy an afternoon of samplings and tastings from a large selection of the area's finest restaurants as well as a variety of fine wines and other beverages in a beautiful outdoor setting. Your participation by purchasing a ticket provides financial assistance to many charitable organizations within Sarasota and Manatee counties No tickets will be sold at the gate. 1 p.m. - 4 p.m. Premier Sports Campus, 5895 Post Blvd., Lakewood Ranch, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November Sarasota Events

November 2, 2024: Are you ready for a rockin’ good time? It's the 11th Annual Rockin' Lobster Beach Party at Sharky's On the Pier. Enjoy the easy, breezy atmosphere at our Rockin’ Lobster Beach Party as the sun sets over the Venice Fishing Pier. Kick back and relax in a special lounge where you can sip on all of your favorite libations. There will be lobster and delectable fare from Fins at Sharky’s, scrumptious s’mores, upbeat live music, and impactful testimonials from Children First families. 6 p.m. - 11 p.m. Individual ticket $250. Sharky's On the Pier, 1600 Harbor Drive S., Venice, FL.

November 2, 2024: It's the grand return of The Bash at The Bishop, A Celestial Affair, benefiting The Bishop Museum of Science and Nature, one of Bradenton’s top cultural venues. Highlights of the evening include cocktails, dinner, dancing. Formal attire. 6 p.m. - 11 p.m. The Bishop Museum of Science and Nature. 201 10th St. West, Bradenton, FL

November 2, 2024: It's Rock the Roof with more rock, more roll and a guarantee to get you on your feet in a heartbeat. The roof of Sarasota Memorial’s West Parking Garage will rock out. Join them under the stars for a rockin’ party like no other benefitting Women and Children’s Services at SMH. 7 p.m. SMH-Sarasota’s West Parking Garage, 1818 Hawthorne St, Sarasota, FL

November 2 - 3, 2024: It's the 36th Annual Venice Art Fest, originally begun in 1987. Another of the numerous open air festivals on my November Sarasota Events Calendar, this outdoor event is held in Historic Downtown Venice, on west Venice Avenue. With free admission for all, the Fest takes place from 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. each day and features the works of over 150 artists. The weather in Sarasota and along the gulf coast is usually perfect for the Venice Art Fest. West Venice Avenue, Downtown Venice, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November Sarasota Events

November 2 - 3, 2024:: The USAF Thunderbirds Return to the Florida International Air Show. Take a trip down to Charlotte County for the Florida International Air Show at the Punta Gorda Airport. From static displays of aircraft to flying high overhead, the show will also feature a variety of performers. Saturday & Sunday: gates open at 9 a.m. with noon shows. Ticket includes free parking. Various ticket prices and packages $15 - $75. If for any reason this Air Show is cancelled, your ticket will be honored at the following event. Punta Gorda Airport, Challenger Blvd, Punta Gorda, FL

November 2 - 3, 2024: For some old time fun check out the 20th annual Sarasota Medieval Fair and their new location: The Woods of Mallaranny! The Woods of Mallaranny offers 47-acres of stunning natural surroundings that will bring the fair to life. There are knights, jesters, minstrels, belly dancers, wenches, and sword swingers! Watch the full contact joust and human combat chess tournaments! Ride rides and play games. Feast on turkey legs and hearty ales from the English pubs. The Sarasota Medieval Fair brings together local artisans, performers, and vendors, and serves as a fundraiser to multiple non-profit organizations Various ticket options and prices available. Free parking. 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Also Nov 9 - 10, Nov 16-17, Nov 23 - 24. The Woods of Mallaranny is located right on SR-70, approximately 13 miles east of I-75 (moments past Lakewood Ranch and across from Dakin Farms). Woods of Mallaranny, 29847 FL-70 E., Myakka City, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 3, 2024: It's the annual Sarasota Manatee Bicycle Club’s premier southwest Florida event: Gulf Coast Cycle-Fest! Join with other cyclists from around the country as they enjoy new routes through Manatee County and Sarasota County. With four beautiful cycling routes from 20 - 100 miles through Manatee and Sarasota counties, there is a ride for every rider. Not a race, it's designed to be a whole family event with routes of 25, 36, 50, and 75 mile routes, well-stocked rest stops, continental breakfast, boxed lunch. Limit of 850 riders. Event time: 7 a.m. - 1 p.m. Fees: Register by September 30 for $60.00. Event location: 8100 Lakewood Main Street, Lakewood Ranch, FL.

November 3, 2024: The 2024 Brunch on the Bay at University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee campus will feature fine cuisine from area restaurants and caterers served on the campus courtyard, with proceeds supporting student scholarships and campus expansion initiatives. For more information about tickets and sponsorships for the 2023 Brunch on the Bay, contact Pam Gleason at (941) 359-4603. 11:30 a.m. - 1:30 p.m. University of South Florida Sarasota-Manatee, 8350 N. Tamiami Trail, Sarasota, FL 34243, USA

November Sarasota Events

November 3, 2024: Enjoy Sarasota's own Ski-A-Rees Water Ski Team and their Sunday afternoon show at 2 p.m. at Ski-A-Ree Stadium. This is the last show of the fall season. This free show takes place at 1602 Ken Thompson Parkway (near/behind Mote Marine Aquarium on the water.) More info at: 388-1666. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 3 - 4, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the annual Dia de los Muertos / Festival of the Skeletons, one of the highlights of the year! Dias De Los Muertos is a colorful festival centered around the traditional Day of the Dead. From 6 p.m. - 9:30 p.m. on Friday, and 11 a.m. - 6 p.m. on Saturday, Grab your friends and come on out to explore the art during their biggest event of the year - Festival of the Skeletons! Enjoy the galleries, shops, restaurants, live music, and tasty treats during one of Bradenton's favorite events. Village of the Arts, 1227 12th St W, Bradenton, FL.

November 3 - 5, 2023: TBA for 2024. There's a Gem, Jewelry & Bead Show with lots on display to see from dealers from around the country selling gems, jewelry, beads, crystals and more. Adults $5. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Sarasota Municipal Auditorium, 801 N. Tamiami Trail, Sarasota, FL.

November 3 - 5, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the Sahib Shrine Circus and Family Festival with food, drink and entertainment. They'll also have elephant, camel and pony rides. Bounce houses, games, prizes, vendors, human cannonball. Opens Friday at 2 p.m., Saturday & Sunday opens at noon. Circus tickets $10 - $45. Sahib Shrine Event Center, 600 N. Beneva Rd., Sarasota, FL

November Sarasota Events

November 4, 2023: TBA for 2024. Enjoy the atmosphere of the 19th Annual St. Jude Hispanic Fall Festival which will feature live entertainment, music, dance, food, culture, kids' activities and fun.10 a.m. - 6 p.m. Admission is free. Tickets available to buy for food purchases. St. Jude Catholic Church, 3930 17th Street, Sarasota, FL. More info: 941-955-3934. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 4, 2024: Join the Venice Concert Band for Home of the Brave as they return to the stage with a concert that will honor not only our military veterans, but also our great country! If you do not have season tickets, you can purchase $14 tickets online two weeks before each performance or $14 (cash only) tickets at the door on concert dates. All concerts are at 7 p.m. Doors open at 6:15 p.m. Venice Performing Arts Center (VPAC), 1 Indian Avenue, Venice, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 5, 2024 - April 8, 2025:Enjoy the Bayfront Gardens at The Ringling for Acoustic Sunsets with a solo musician on Ca' d'Zan Terrace! This event will feature Gustav Viehmeyer performing acoustic music as the sun sets on beautiful Sarasota Bay. Food and beverages will be available for purchase. 5:30 p.m. $15 Members. Tickets will be available 60 days prior to each event. Individual members may purchase up to 1 per event; Duo or higher may purchase up to 2 per event. The Ringling Museum, 5401 Bay Shore Road, Sarasota, FL

November 7, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the Bradenton Kiwanis Annual Veterans Appreciation Lunch. Doors open 11:15 a.m. Program begins Noon sharp. Manatee Performing Arts Center, 502 3rd Ave. W., Bradenton. Tickets are required, and a limited number are available at Manatee Veterans Services, 1401 3rd Ave. W., Bradenton. For more information, call (941) 745-3795.

November Sarasota Events

November 7, 2024: It's Ringling Underground. Enjoy live music, art and atmosphere in the Museum of Art Courtyard during Ringling Underground 8 p.m. -11 p.m. This event features an eclectic mix of local, regional, and national live music. Check out up-and-coming artists displaying their work in the Museum of Art Courtyard. $15 / Free for Students w/ ID & Members. Free with Art after 5 Admission. The Courtyard at The John and Mable Ringling Museum of Art, 5401 Bay Shore Rd, Sarasota, FL. (941) 359-5700

November 8, 2024: You're invited to the 24th Annual Empty Bowls Luncheon benefiting The Food Bank of Manatee. The purpose of Empty Bowls is uniting to show support for the critical work of Meals on Wheels PLUS through The Food Bank of Manatee!. Guests who attend Empty Bowls select a beautiful, handcrafted bowl to keep and enjoy soup, bread, and desserts donated by local restaurants. General admission $35. 11 a.m. - 1 p.m. Main Street, Lakewood Ranch, FL

November 8, 2024: It's the Free Music Friday Night Concert. Enjoy the music of Tiki Vibe in downtown's Centennial Park. Free and open to the public. 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. Bring your chairs and blankets. No alcohol is permitted in Centennial Park. Centennial Park, downtown Venice, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 8 - 10, 2024: It's the Sarasota Boat Expo. Check out a great selection of new boats, fishing gear and more. Adults $6. 12 and under free. Free parking. Fri & Sat 10 a.m. - 6 p.m. Sun 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Robarts Arena, Sarasota Fairgrounds, 3000 Ringling Blvd., Sarasota, FL.

November Sarasota Events

November 8 - 10, 2024: The Sarasota Chalk Festival is back in downtown Sarasota at Burns Square, S. Pineapple & S. Orange Avenues. The art themes change every year and over 500 national and international artists participate in the Sarasota Chalk Festival each year. Each day the Chalk Festival has an interactive zone for the 'Young and Young at Heart' for anyone to get creative with chalk (provided). Downtown Sarasota at Burns Square, S. Pineapple & S. Orange Avenues, Sarasota, FL. Click here for more.

November 9, 2023: TBA for 2024. Enjoy the Sertoma WIneFeast which is a gathering of twelve excellent restaurants and twelve terrific wine merchants to give people a taste of what they serve. The WineFeast is a fundraiser for the Sertoma Speech Clinic, which provides speech therapy for children who cannot necessarily afford it. 6 p.m - 9 p.m. $85 per person. Venice Community Center 326 S. Nokomis, Ave, Venice, FL.

November 9, 2024: More details. parade time, TBA for 2024. See the UTC Christmas Parade with Santa. The holiday season will kick-off in grand style with a magical parade down N. Cattlemen Rd, marking Santa’s official arrival in Sarasota at The Mall at University Town Center! The 1.5-mile-long parade route will run through the heart of the UTC District. Join Santa Claus for a merry celebration that will feature a spectacular light show, a dazzling fireworks display, live entertainment and more! The Mall at University Town Center, 140 University Town Center Drive, Sarasota, FL.

November 9, 2023: TBA for 2024. State College of Florida, Manatee-Sarasota (SCF) Veteran Services will host the college’s annual Veterans Day event honoring those who have served or are currently serving in our nation’s armed forces Thurs., Nov. 9, from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. at SCF Venice, 8000 S. Tamiami Trail at the Performance Pavilion, and 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. at SCF Bradenton, 5840 26th St. W. outside Building 14. The event is free and open to the public, with noted activities available while supplies last. SCF Venice: The annual Veterans Day ceremony at SCF Venice will feature complimentary meals for SCF Student Veterans and families (with ID), a BBQ fundraiser lunch, meeting with American Legion NO-VEL Post 159 members and recruiter stations. Attendees can also learn about Veterans’ benefits, view military displays and make paracord bracelets and honor quilts. 10 a.m. - 1 p.m. 8000 S. Tamiami Trail (at the performance pavilion) Venice, FL. SCF Bradenton: The annual Veterans Day ceremony at SCF Bradenton will feature a tug-of-war competition, crafting thank you cards for veterans, making paracord bracelets and sampling military Meals Ready to Eat (MREs). Attendees can also visit local recruiters. 11 a.m. - 2 p.m. 5840 26 St. W. (outside Building 14) Bradenton, FL

November Sarasota Events

November 9 - 10, 2024: It's the 35th Annual St. Armand's Circle Fall Art Festival and Sidewalk Sale around Circle Park. Usually held under sunny skies, with warm temperatures, this outdoor festival on my Sarasota Calendar of Events is attended by thousands of art lovers who come to see and buy the works of artists from around the nation. Admission is free, as is parking. Hours: 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. both days. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 9 - 10, 2023: It's time to "get crackin" at the 12th Annual Stone Crab & Music Festival in the fishing village of Cortez, along Sarasota Bay. Two days of food, drinks, live music, beer tent plus fresh stone crabs. There will also be a Kid’s Zone and many local artists displaying their wares. A seating area with a large tent will be in place for protection from the sun, or in the event of rain. Music will continue into the evening on stages at the Swordfish Grill & Tiki Bar 10 a.m. - 6 p.m. both days. Parking will be available at the FISH Preserve for $5 per car, guests are advised to enter at 116th Street. Admission will be $5, ages 12 & under will be FREE. Swordfish Grill & Tiki Bar, 4628 119th St W., Cortez, FL. Marker 49 by boat. 941-798-2035. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 9 - 10, 2024: For some old time fun check out the 19th annual Sarasota Medieval Fair and their new location: The Woods of Mallaranny! The Woods of Mallaranny offers 47-acres of stunning natural surroundings that will bring the fair to life. There are knights, jesters, minstrels, belly dancers, wenches, and sword swingers! Watch the full contact joust and human combat chess tournaments! Ride rides and play games. Feast on turkey legs and hearty ales from the English pubs. The Sarasota Medieval Fair brings together local artisans, performers, and vendors, and serves as a fundraiser to multiple non-profit organizations Various ticket options and prices available. Free parking. 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Also Nov 16-17, Nov 23-24. The Woods of Mallaranny is located right on SR-70, approximately 13 miles east of I-75 (moments past Lakewood Ranch and across from Dakin Farms). Woods of Mallaranny, 29847 FL-70 E., Myakka City, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 10, 2024: You are invited to the 18th anniversary of their signature "Bowls of Hope" event at Ed Smith Stadium. Each year more than 1,500 guests attend one of the community’s largest and most popular family-friendly events where 40 of our community’s finest restaurants and caterers serve delicious soups, bread, desserts, and more. Guests select beautiful handcrafted bowls to keep, all donated by local potters, artists, and students while enjoying a modest meal as a reminder of the empty bowls they help to fill. Ed Smith Stadium, 2700 12th St, Sarasota, FL. For questions or sponsorship information, please contact Becky Abraham at 941.549.8131 or events@allfaithsfoodbank.org

November 10, 2023: TBA for 2024. Check out Jazz at Two featuring Robbie Rose Retro Quartet. Jazz pianist Robbie Rose has assembled an outstanding group of musicians for this afternoon concert. Enjoy a great mix of familiar songs from yesteryear, songs from the movies, and a jazzy sound on pop favorites with a little bossa and Latin beat and music from the composers of the American Songbook with Robbie Rose "Retro". . Admission $15-$20 at the door. Unitarian Universalist Church 3975 Fruitville Rd, Sarasota, FL.

November Sarasota Events - Veteran's Day Events

November 8, 2024: The 11th Annual Sarasota Kiwanis Club Veterans' Day Breakfast . Keynote Speaker: Colonel Robert E. Dickson. Single tickets: $25. RSVP: SarasotaKiwanis.com | Kim Noyes: 941-228-9144 or fax: 941-827-2920 - SRQKiwanisVeteransDayBreakfast@gmail.com. 7 a.m. - 9 a.m. Carlisle Inn, 3727 Bahai Vista St., Sarasota, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.

November 10, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the City of Anna Maria’s “Old Soldiers & Sailors Parade.” The parade leaves Anna Maria City Hall at 9 am. It will proceed down Pine Avenue ending at City Pier Park where a short ceremony will honor veterans. (Businesses or individuals interested in participating in the parade should call Anna Maria City Hall at 941-708-6130, ext. 110 Monday-Friday 8 a.m.-4 p.m.) November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. The American Legion NO-VEL Post 159 of Venice will once again host the annual Veterans Day Observance and Ceremony. The ceremony will include a Salute to Armed Forces, Color Guard, and guest speakers Gordon Shervin Veterans of Foreign Wars and Norman MacLellan and God Bless America by the Sun Coast Wind Ensemble. There will also be a City of Venice Proclamation from Mayor Nick Pachota, Rifle Salute, and Memorial Taps. The public is invited; please bring chairs. 11 a.m. Patriots Park,: 800 Venetia Bay Blvd, just off Rt. 41 south of Roberts Bay on the east side of Rt 41 (just north of the Legacy Trail Bridge over Rt. 41 in Venice), Venice, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. The Sarasota Annual Veterans Day Parade and Ceremony. The ceremony will feature as guest speaker Carlos Moreira, Jan Solomon will commemorate her father, Chaplain J.D. Hamel, 100th birthday. The parade will include veterans groups, community organizations and local dignitaries. From marching bands to antique military vehicles and more! Keep an eye on the front of the parade, where two local World War II veterans will be honored for their courage, bravery and sacrifice. The parade will begin at 10 a.m. at Osprey Avenue/Main Street in downtown and will move westward on Main Street, ending at Gulfstream Avenue, Sarasota, FL. Ceremony to follow at 11:00 a.m. at Chaplain J.D. Hamel Park. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November Sarasota Events - Veteran's Day Events

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. The Manatee County Veterans Council will co host with the city of Palmetto the Veteran's Day Parade to be held in Palmetto at the Grand Stand in Sutton Park. All veteran organizations, JROTC, High Schools and other bands are invited to participate. The parade will form and begin at the Manatee County Fairgrounds at 9:30 a.m. and end at Sutton Park. Parade staging begins at 8 a.m. The parade stpes off at 9:30 a.m. sharp. After the parade there will be the annual Veteran's Day Memorial Service beinning at 11 a.m. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. The Diocese of Venice in Florida will hold a Veteran's Day Memorial Mass in honor of the men and women who have served our country and continue to serve and protect us today. This is the 14th year the Diocese will hold a Mass on Veterans Day. Bishop Frank J. Dewane will celebrate the Mass The priests, deacons and Knights of Columbus in the Diocese will join Bishop Dewane for this important event. All are invited to attend, and active military personnel are asked to wear their uniform. Attendees are also encouraged to wear sunscreen and bring a hat. All guests are encouraged to arrive early for pre-Mass ceremonials which begin at 2:45 p.m. There is ample seating and parking at the cemetery. 3 p.m. Sarasota National Cemetery, 9810 State Road 72/Clark Road, about five miles east of I-75. More information: Gail Ardy at ardy@dioceseofvenice.org or 941-486-4714. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the Veterans Day Observance & Ribbon Cutting of the Karon Family Pavilion. A Veterans program and milestone celebration of the Town Center development with a performance by the Sarasota Orchestra. 3 p.m. Town Center, 600 Bay Isles Road, Longboat Key, FL.

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. The Manatee Community Concert Band kicks off their season with their first concert, "God Bless America," a special Veteran's Day Performance. Tickets are $15 each. Save $10 when you purchase a Season Ticket. 7 p.m. All Concerts are at the Neel Performing Arts Center on the campus of State College of Florida. SCF Neel Performing Arts Center - 5840 26th Street West, Building 11 East, Bradenton, FL

November Sarasota Events

November 11, 2023: TBA for 2024. Check it out: the 8th annual Symphony on the Sand, a musical and gourmet event featuring the Anna Maria Island Concert Chorus & Orchestra, will return to Coquina Beach and provide the opportunity for you to enjoy the award-winning Anna Maria Island Concert Chorus & Orchestra (a 45-piece orchestra) during sunset on Anna Maria Island as well as wine, beer and the best delicacies from the top area restaurants. Several options available with tickets from $30 - $250. 4:30 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. Coquina Beach Gulfside Park, Gulf Drive, Anna Maria Island, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 11, 2023 - January 2, 2024: TBA for 2024. It's time to lace up your skates for some wintertime funat UTC. The Rink at UTC, presented by the Tampa Bay Lightning, opens November 11th and will run daily through January 2nd. Mon - Fri 4 p.m. - 10 p.m. Saturday & Sunday: 11 a.m. - 10 p.m. School holidays: 11 a.m. - 10 p.m. The Rink is located in the East District at UTC. The Mall at University Town Center, 140 University Town Center Dr., Sarasota, FL.

November 12, 2023: TBA for 2024. The 5th Annual SRQ Craft Beer Festival will feature over a dozen breweries plus live music, kids activities like face painting, bounce house and animal balloons. 12 p.m. - 4 p.m. $35 advance/$30 day of. Original Craft Beer and Pizza Cafe, 1837 Hillview St., Sarasota, FL.

November 14, 2024: Check out Downtown Sarasota’s Enchanting Christmas Tree Lighting. Selby Five Points Park becomes the backdrop for a magical evening of joy, music, and festive lights. Choirs will warm up the crowd for a visit from Santa Claus at 7 p.m. It's all taking place in Downtown Sarasota, as the Selby Five Points Park transforms into a holiday haven, complete with the majestic centerpiece—the dazzling Christmas Tree which will be lit at 7 p.m. Refreshments donated by Pastry Art Cafe at 1512 Main Street. 6 p.m. - 8 p.m. Selby Five Points Park, 1 Central Ave, Sarasota, FL

November Sarasota Events

November 14 - 17, 2024: It's the Englewood Beach Waterfest, Englewood's version of the Sarasota Offshore Grand Prix Super Boat Racing Fest. Numerous events plus multiple classes of offshore racing with boats moving at more than 200 mph! PowerUp Pre- Race Party Thursday, Waterfest Block Party Friday, OPA Racing World Championships Saturday & Sunday. Events at various locations and, Englewood Beach, Manasota Key, FL November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 15, 2024: Introducing Friends FULL of Giving, an evening of friends, food, and fun at an exquisite location in Casey Key. All proceeds will benefit the ThankFULL tummies campaign that provides turkeys to our neighbors facing hunger during the holiday season. Guests are invited to join us for an evening of friends, food, and fun on Friday, November 15 at an exquisite location in Casey Key overlooking the Gulf. Click on the link above for more details.

November 15 - 18, 2024: Come out and enjoy the 15th Annual Siesta Key Crystal Classic Master Sand Sculpting Competition. Master Sand Sculptors from across the U.S. will compete for thousands in prize money. Other events connected to the competition will take place, as well: The Learning Curve - sand sculpting lessons and demonstrations are hosted multiple times daily, Fri - Sun; the Barefoot Beach Bar Party Tent is open all 4 days with music and a full bar- no entry fee. Vendor Village surrounding Sand Village features over 90 retail vendors and 5 food trailers which are all open to the public. Friday: 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Saturday: 10 a.m. - 9 p.m., Sunday & Monday: 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Various on line ticket packages including reserved private parking. More options on line for advance purchase. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 16, 2024: Enjoy the Celebrity Softball Game and Concert featuring Joe Nichols & special guest Jackson Dean. The Atlanta Braves are teaming up to introduce the Annual Celebrity Softball Game and Concert. Net proceeds benefit local Veteran and First Responder programs, My Warriors Place and Operation Warrior Resolution. One Ticket buys you a seat at the game AND the Concert. Gates open at 2:30 p.m. for tailgating, Softball game at 4 p.m. Music starts at 7 p.m. Tickets: $45. CoolToday Park, 18800 W Villages Pkwy, North Port, FL

November Sarasota Events

November 16, 2023: TBA for 2024. Enjoy “Jazz at the Movies” presented by SCF’s Jazz Orchestra. From Casablanca to West Side Story, this concert/film screening presents great moments of swing on the silver screen. It is directed by Dr. Pete Carney, and two special guests, Grammy-winner saxophonist and composer Chip McNeill and American Songbook Master and vocalist Bryan J. Hughes. 7:30 p.m. Tickets for each performance can be purchased online at SCF.edu/Neel or by calling 941-752-5252. Tickets are $15 for general admission and $5 for SCF students and staff unless otherwise noted. SCF Neel Performing Arts Center, 5840 26th St W, Bradenton, FL

November 16 - 17, 2024: It's the Sarasota Open Air Fine Art Show. This quality juried fine art and fine craft show bring artists with all disciplines to sell their original and personally handmade art. The focus is visual arts and fine arts and fine crafts created by award-winning artists from around the world with all disciplines for sale – paintings, clay, glass, sculpture, fiber, wood, jewelry, and more. There is free admission; $5 parking supports Institute for the Arts & Education, Inc. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. Phillippi Estate Park, 5500 S Tamiami Trail, Sarasota, FL.

November 16 - 17, 2024: New Location TBA for 2024. The Sarasota Fall Fine Art Festival returns for its 11th season. Whether you are an art collector or wish to find original, creative handmade arts and fine crafts for home or office, come see the palette of art the event will lay for you. 10 a.m. - 5 p.m. This fine art festival is held in downtown Sarasota in JD Hamel Park at Gulfstream and Main Street.

November 16 - 17, 2024: For some old time fun check out the 19th annual Sarasota Medieval Fair and their new location: The Woods of Mallaranny! The Woods of Mallaranny offers 47-acres of stunning natural surroundings that will bring the fair to life. There are knights, jesters, minstrels, belly dancers, wenches, and sword swingers! Watch the full contact joust and human combat chess tournaments! Ride rides and play games. Feast on turkey legs and hearty ales from the English pubs. The Sarasota Medieval Fair brings together local artisans, performers, and vendors, and serves as a fundraiser to multiple non-profit organizations Various ticket options and prices available. Free parking. 10 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Also Nov 23-24. The Woods of Mallaranny is located right on SR-70, approximately 13 miles east of I-75 (moments past Lakewood Ranch and across from Dakin Farms). Woods of Mallaranny, 29847 FL-70 E., Myakka City, FL.

November 16 - 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. You're invited to enjoy the Annual Christmas in Pinecraft Arts & Crafts Festival. Many crafts and artisans featuring unique handmade wooden items, textiles, jewelry. Many items made by local Mennonite and Amish community members. Hand quilting by local Amish ladies. Good time to shop for unique one of a kind items made in the USA. Free admission. 9 a.m. - 4 p.m. Pinecraft Plaza between Der Dutchman restaurant and Alma Sue's Quilt Shop.. 3737 Bahia Vista Street, Sarasota, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 17 - December 31, 2024: It's the annual “FESTIVAL OF LIGHTS,” a display of more than ONE MILLION LIGHTS and themed decorations inside and outside at Fisherman's Village. 1200 W. Retta Esplanade Punta Gorda, FL. (Fishermen’s Village Waterfront Mall, Resort and Marina is located on Marion Avenue, Punta Gorda. From I-75, take exit 164, turn left and proceed 3 miles to Fishermen’s Village.)

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. Gather your family for a day of pure enjoyment! at their Gamble Creek Farm's Harvest Festival. Experience live music, exciting family games, delightful photo moments, pumpkins, mouthwatering food, and endless fun for all ages! 9 a.m. - 12 p.m. 14950 Golf Course Road Parrish, FL.

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. The Creative Arts Association of Lakewood Ranch is hosting its 20th Annual Fall Art Show and Sale. This art and gifts show features original works of art by local artists and artisans in various mediums, including watercolor, jewelry, pottery, ceramic, wood turning, pastels, acrylics, mixed media and more. Free admission. 9 a.m. - 4 p.m. Free Admission & Parking. Lakewood Ranch Town Hall, 8175 Lakewood Ranch Blvd., Lakewood Ranch, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the return of the wildly popular 3rd annual Grilled Cheese Festival. The free, family-friendly event will feature food trucks, a beer garden, live music, kids’ activities, and more. Each food truck will offer grilled cheese themed items along with their regular menu. Craft and domestic beers will be available for purchase, along with a custom beer stein. In 2022 Parking was $5 per car. 11 a.m. - 6 p.m. CoolToday Park, 18800 S. West Villages Pkwy., Venice, FL.

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. Take a short road trip to Punta Gorda. Fishermen’s Village will herald in the Holiday Season with their spectacular “Lighting of the Village.” This celebration is the official kick off of the annual “FESTIVAL OF LIGHTS,” a display of more than ONE MILLION LIGHTS and themed decorations. Start your evening at Sunset Beach Club as the Shane Duncan Band takes the stage at 5:00pm. Santa will arrive at 5:45 p.m. via the Punta Gorda Fire Department, followed by a ribbon cutting ceremony culminating in the grand Lighting of the Village at 6:20 p.m.! Visits with Santa and the Grinch until 9 pm after Lighting Fishermen's Village, 1200 W. Retta Esplanade Punta Gorda, FL. (Fishermen’s Village Waterfront Mall, Resort and Marina is located on Marion Avenue, Punta Gorda. From I-75, take exit 164, turn left and proceed 3 miles to Fishermen’s Village.)

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. Kick off the Holidays in Paradise 2023 and Light Up Bradenton Beach with caroling, hot chocolate and the annual Lighting of the Bridge Street Christmas Tree at the Post Office on Bridge Street. 5:30 p.m. - 8:30 p.m. The lighting of the 42' tall tree lighting marks the kickoff of their Annual Light Up Bradenton Beach. Bradenton Beach’s Historic Business District, Bridge Street area, Bradenton Beach, Anna Maria Island. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November 18, 2023: TBA for 2024. Check out some heavenly bodies during Sidewalk Astronomy courtesy of the local group of Deep Sky Observers. Observing highlights for the evening will include the beautiful ringed planet Saturn, giant Jupiter and all four of its Galilean moons, as well as extraordinary close-up views of the features on our own Moon. Other deep-sky objects, as well as a couple of additional planets will also be featured in the club member’s telescopes. Free, 6 p.m. - 10 p.m. Celery Fields, 6799 Palmer Blvd, Sarasota, FL. Parking will be available in the large lot just WEST of the Nature Center building. The telescopes will be set up in the small parking lot on the east side of the Nature Center.

November 22, 2024: It's the Free Music Friday Night Concert. Enjoy the music of Kraig Kenning in downtown's Centennial Park. Free and open to the public. 7 p.m. - 9 p.m. Bring your chairs and blankets. No alcohol is permitted in Centennial Park. Centennial Park, downtown Venice, FL.

November 22, 2023: TBA for 2024. Come party in Downtown Bradenton at their Pre-Thanksgiving Party! Hosted by Out & About Bradenton With Tyler Butler. November 24, 2024: Giddy up, giddy up! It's the 32nd Annual Ponies under the Palms benefit car show featuring Mustangs and other Ford Powered cars and trucks. (For auto exhibitors: $25 to register your car for the show, $30 day of show. Check in is 8:00 a.m. Award ceremony is at 3:00 p.m. Proceeds will benefit two wonderful charities: Denis V. Cooper Foundation “Wishes for Heroes” to benefit local needy military veterans and Take Stock in Children a scholarship and mentoring program for low-income secondary students who aspire to post high school education. Free admission. 8 a.m. - 3 p.m. Main Street at Lakewood Ranch, FL . Sponsored by the Mustang Club of West Central Florida. More info at 920-944-8137.

November 25, 2023: TBA for 2024. It's the 38th annual Light Up Siesta Key & Village Holiday Parade. Festive décor and holiday atmosphere will Light Up Siesta Key. Enjoy the Christmas Tree Lighting at the Village Gazebo and the holiday parade which begins at Avenida del Mare and Beach Road at 5:30 p.m. and travels north on Beach Road onto Ocean Blvd. and on into the Village. Local businesses and groups will participate in the parade and welcome Santa to Siesta Key Village. Santa will arrive at the Siesta Center immediately following the parade to greet children. Photos may be taken with Santa, free of charge. Gift bags provided for the first 250 kids to visit Santa. Free public transportation is provided courtesy of the Siesta Breeze Trolley from Turtle Beach to the Village (with multiple stops along the route, including Siesta Beach). Live music at various places, carolers, refreshments and holiday bargains. Free and open to the public. 5 p.m. - 9 p.m. Siesta Key Village, Siesta Key, Sarasota, FL. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 28, 2024: It's the 7th Annual Florida Turkey Trot Thanksgiving morning, 8 a.m., with the Kids Dash at 7:15 a.m. This 5K run/walk event brings nearly 4,000 runners, joggers and walkers from across the Suncoast and beyond for what's become a new Thanksgiving tradition. All participants will receive a finisher medal. The top 100 overall male and top 100 overall female finishers will receive a special Thanksgiving themed award that will be given out in the post race party. Entry fee: $20 - $40. Thanksgiving morning at 8 a.m. Nathan Benderson Park, 5851 Nathan Benderson Cir, Sarasota, FL 34235 November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November Sarasota Events

November 29, 2024: It's The Mayor's Hometown Christmas! Get ready to kick off the holiday season with The Mayor’s Hometown Christmas in Downtown Venice! Enjoy the Christmas tree lighting as local choirs bring the festive spirit and holiday cheer. Also enjoy time with Santa, shop, dine and explore Historic Downtown Venice businesses. Bring your chairs or blankets. 5 p.m. - 7 p.m. Centennial Park, 200 W Venice Ave, Venice, FL

November 29 - December 1, 2024: Enjoy warm gulf breezes, fresh seafood and live musical performances at the 8th Annual Sarasota Seafood & Music Festival. Enjoy the best and freshest cooked foods by local restaurants and food purveyors. Foods are cooked on-site using such ingredients as grouper, mahi mahi, stone crabs, oysters, shrimp and soft-shell crabs. A variety of vegetarian and rice dishes are available as well as non-seafood items. Live music, too: While savoring your meal, relax to some of Florida’s top musical groups from genres such as R&B, blues, jazz, rock and Caribbean sounds. On the breaks between performances, enjoy shopping in a marketplace of fine arts, crafts, and select fine products and food items. Free admission. Fri: 4:30 p.m. - 10 p.m., Sat 11 a.m. - 10 p.m. & Sun: 11 a.m. - 6 p.m. Sarasota Fairgrounds, Ringling Boulevard, Sarasota, FL.

November 29 - December 1, 2024: Check out the Fall Classic Sports Collectors Show. Dealers will be buying & selling sports cards & memorabilia from the 19th century to present. 100 dealer tables. "Free Appraisals," Card Grading & Autograph Authentication Services. Baseball, Football. Basketball, Hockey, Boxing, Soccer, Pokemon, Comics. $3 Admission (12 and under free) & Free Parking. Friday 10 a.m. - 5 p.m., Saturday 9 a.m. - 4 p.m. Sunday 9 a.m. - 3 p.m. Hotel Venezia Banquet Center, 425 US 41 By-Pass North, Venice, FL.

November 30, 2024:Check out Breakfast with the Sharks and start your day with their sharks before the Mote Aquarium opens to the public. You and your chums will have a great time sinking your teeth into a light continental breakfast while you learn about our favorite finned friends and Mote’s breakthrough shark research. During this program, you'll meet our resident sharks, watch a narrated feeding of our bonnetheads, and have all of your shark questions answered. After breakfast, you’ll learn about the breakthrough research going on at Mote during a guided tour of our Aquarium. 8 a.m. - 9:30 p.m. Breakfast with the Sharks does not include general admission to Mote Marine Laboratory. Advanced reservations are required. All participants under the age of 18 must be accompanied by a paid adult participant. $36 member adults, $40 non-member adults; $27 member youth, $30 non-member youth; 2 and younger are free. Mote Marine Laboratory & Aquarium, 1600 Ken Thompson Parkway, Sarasota, FL November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota.com

November Sarasota Events

November 30, 2024: It's the kickoff to the Sun Coast's holiday season with The Venice Holiday Parade which traditionally takes place the Saturday evening after Thanksgiving. The 45 year tradition continues when the annual Parade steps off at 6:30 p.m. on the streets of Historic Downtown Venice at the corner of Park Blvd. and W. Venice Ave (south side). It will proceed on the north side of W. Venice Ave. after crossing over Harbor Drive. From there, it will make a turn on Nokomis Avenue and go all the way down to Turin Street, where it turns right, ultimately making its way to the Venice Community Center, where the parade ends. Here's a map of the parade route. The Venice Holiday Parade is expected to draw 40,000 viewers. No early setup of chairs, blankets, etc. along the parade route. These items will be removed by the City. Chairs may be set up the afternoon of the parade ONLY. Additionally, with the complete redesign and expensive landscaping of the Venice Avenue median, spectators will not be permitted to use the median as a parade viewing site. Signage will be posted. November Sarasota Events on Escape-to-Sarasota

November 30, 2023: TBA for 2024. Enjoy “Merry & Bright.” Join SCF Choirs, SCF Guitar Ensemble and SCF Bradenton Symphony Orchestra for a festive holiday concert reveling in the sights and sounds of the season with a fresh take on contemporary and traditional selections. 7:30 p.m. Tickets for each performance can be purchased online at SCF.edu/Neel or by calling 941-752-5252. Tickets are $15 for general admission and $5 for SCF students and staff unless otherwise noted. SCF Neel Performing Arts Center, 5840 26th St W, Bradenton, FL

November 30 - December 3, 2023: TBA for 2024. You're invited to the Singing Christmas Tree Spectacular to enjoy the wonder of Christmas. Presented by the First Sarasota Downtown Baptist Church, The Singing Christmas Tree, some 25 feet tall, sporting over 10,000 lights with 12 levels that hold 115 choir members, is a music and drama production written & directed by church members and accompanied by an orchestra featuring songs of the Christmas Season and stunning pageantry. There are 5 performances taking place, Nov. 30 at 7 p.m., Dec 1 at 7 p.m., Dec 2 at 11 a.m., Dec 2 at 2 p.m. and Dec 3 at 5 p.m. Tickets: Adults: $20, children: $15. Tickets available here to buy online. First Baptist Church of Sarasota, 1661 Main St, Sarasota, FL. More info: 941-365-2846.

November 30 - December 22, 2024: Take a ride on the North Pole Express, a 35 minute ride from Parrish, FL to the North Pole. Upon arrival, everyone will detrain at our special North Pole station where Santa awaits to visit with every child. During your stay a variety of entertainment, activities, camp fires and all the hot chocolate and cookies you care to eat are included with every train ticket. Additional food and beverage will be available for purchase at the North Pole. Various dates/times/ticket prices. All children Ages One and Up must have a ticket for the North Pole Express. Florida Railroad Museum, 12210 83rd Street East, Parrish, FL. (941) 776-0906
